content.text:
Please analyze this codebase and create a CLAUDE.md file, which will be given to future instances of Claude Code to operate in this repository.

What to add:
1. Commands that will be commonly used, such as how to build, lint, and run tests. Include the necessary commands to develop in this codebase, such as how to run a single test.
2. High-level code architecture and structure so that future instances can be productive more quickly. Focus on the "big picture" architecture that requires reading multiple files to understand.

Usage notes:
- If there's already a CLAUDE.md, suggest improvements to it.
- When you make the initial CLAUDE.md, do not repeat yourself and do not include obvious instructions like "Provide helpful error messages to users", "Write unit tests for all new utilities", "Never include sensitive information (API keys, tokens) in code or commits".
- Avoid listing every component or file structure that can be easily discovered.
- Don't include generic development practices.
- If there are Cursor rules (in .cursor/rules/ or .cursorrules) or Copilot rules (in .github/copilot-instructions.md), make sure to include the important parts.
- If there is a README.md, make sure to include the important parts.
- Do not make up information such as "Common Development Tasks", "Tips for Development", "Support and Documentation" unless this is expressly included in other files that you read.
- Be sure to prefix the file with the following text:

```
# CLAUDE.md

This file provides guidance to Claude Code (claude.ai/code) when working with code in this repository.
```
I'll analyze the codebase and create an improved CLAUDE.md file based on the existing one and additional insights from the repository structure.

1‚Üí# NixOS Hydenix Configuration
     2‚Üí
     3‚ÜíA modern, modular NixOS configuration using Hydenix, Hyprland, and flakes with automatic hardware detection and GitHub synchronization.
     4‚Üí
     5‚Üí## üöÄ Features
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí- **Hydenix Desktop Environment** - Pre-configured Hyprland-based desktop with modern aesthetics
     8‚Üí- **Automatic Hardware Detection** - Smart hardware configuration management that survives repository syncs
     9‚Üí- **Auto-commit to GitHub** - Automatically commits and pushes configuration changes on rebuild
    10‚Üí- **Flake-based Configuration** - Reproducible, version-pinned system configuration
    11‚Üí- **Home Manager Integration** - Declarative user environment management
    12‚Üí- **Modular Structure** - Clean separation of system and user configurations
    13‚Üí
    14‚Üí## üìã Prerequisites
    15‚Üí
    16‚Üí- NixOS 24.11 or later
    17‚Üí- Git installed and configured
    18‚Üí- GitHub account (for auto-sync features)
    19‚Üí- Basic understanding of NixOS and flakes
    20‚Üí
    21‚Üí## üõ†Ô∏è Installation
    22‚Üí
    23‚Üí### 1. Clone the Repository
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí```bash
    26‚Üísudo git clone https://github.com/0x64616e61/nix-modules.git /nix-modules
    27‚Üícd /nix-modules
    28‚Üí```
    29‚Üí
    30‚Üí### 2. Hardware Configuration
    31‚Üí
    32‚ÜíThe system automatically detects and uses your local hardware configuration. No manual copying required!
    33‚Üí
    34‚Üí‚ö†Ô∏è **Important**: Always rebuild with the `--impure` flag to ensure hardware detection works:
    35‚Üí
    36‚Üí```bash
    37‚Üísudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
    38‚Üí```
    39‚Üí
    40‚Üí### 3. Initial Setup
    41‚Üí
    42‚Üí1. **Update User Configuration**
    43‚Üí   - Edit `configuration.nix`
    44‚Üí   - Change username from "a" to your desired username (lines 75 and 87)
    45‚Üí   - Update initial password (line 89)
    46‚Üí   - Set your hostname (line 103)
    47‚Üí   - Configure timezone and locale (lines 104-105)
    48‚Üí
    49‚Üí2. **Configure GitHub Authentication** (for auto-sync)
    50‚Üí   ```bash
    51‚Üí   gh auth login
    52‚Üí   ```
    53‚Üí
    54‚Üí3. **Build and Switch**
    55‚Üí   ```bash
    56‚Üí   sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
    57‚Üí   ```
    58‚Üí
    59‚Üí## üìÅ Project Structure
    60‚Üí
    61‚Üí```
    62‚Üí/nix-modules/
    63‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ flake.nix                 # Flake configuration entrypoint
    64‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ flake.lock               # Version lock file
    65‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ configuration.nix        # Main system configuration
    66‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ hardware-config.nix      # Hardware detection wrapper
    67‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ hardware-configuration.nix  # Placeholder (auto-replaced)
    68‚Üí‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ modules/
    69‚Üí‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ system/             # System-level modules
    70‚Üí‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ auto-commit.nix # GitHub auto-sync module
    71‚Üí‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ hm/                 # Home Manager modules
    72‚Üí‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ docs/                   # Documentation
    73‚Üí```
    74‚Üí
    75‚Üí## üîß Configuration
    76‚Üí
    77‚Üí### System Configuration
    78‚Üí
    79‚ÜíMain configuration file: `configuration.nix`
    80‚Üí
    81‚ÜíKey settings to customize:
    82‚Üí- **Username**: Update in both `home-manager.users` and `users.users`
    83‚Üí- **Hostname**: Set in `hydenix.hostname`
    84‚Üí- **Timezone**: Set in `hydenix.timezone` (e.g., "America/New_York")
    85‚Üí- **Locale**: Set in `hydenix.locale` (e.g., "en_US.UTF-8")
    86‚Üí- **Hardware modules**: Uncomment relevant lines for GPU, CPU, laptop features
    87‚Üí
    88‚Üí### Home Manager Configuration
    89‚Üí
    90‚ÜíUser-specific configurations in `modules/hm/`
    91‚Üí
    92‚ÜíManages:
    93‚Üí- Desktop environment settings
    94‚Üí- Application configurations
    95‚Üí- User packages
    96‚Üí- Dotfiles
    97‚Üí
    98‚Üí## üéØ Key Features Explained
    99‚Üí
   100‚Üí### Automatic Hardware Detection
   101‚Üí
   102‚ÜíThe configuration includes a smart hardware detection system that:
   103‚Üí- Uses `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` when available
   104‚Üí- Falls back to a placeholder for repository storage
   105‚Üí- Survives git pulls without breaking your system
   106‚Üí- Requires `--impure` flag for nixos-rebuild
   107‚Üí
   108‚Üí### Auto-commit to GitHub
   109‚Üí
   110‚ÜíOn every rebuild, the system:
   111‚Üí1. Checks for uncommitted changes
   112‚Üí2. Automatically commits with timestamp
   113‚Üí3. Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI
   114‚Üí4. Handles authentication gracefully
   115‚Üí
   116‚ÜíTo disable auto-commit, remove this line from `configuration.nix`:
   117‚Üí```nix
   118‚Üí./modules/system/auto-commit.nix
   119‚Üí```
   120‚Üí
   121‚Üí### Hydenix Integration
   122‚Üí
   123‚ÜíHydenix provides:
   124‚Üí- Pre-configured Hyprland window manager
   125‚Üí- Modern UI/UX with animations
   126‚Üí- Integrated application launcher
   127‚Üí- Workspace management
   128‚Üí- Screen recording/screenshot tools
   129‚Üí
   130‚Üí## üîÑ Daily Usage
   131‚Üí
   132‚Üí### Rebuilding the System
   133‚Üí
   134‚ÜíAlways use the impure flag for hardware detection:
   135‚Üí```bash
   136‚Üícd /nix-modules
   137‚Üísudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
   138‚Üí```
   139‚Üí
   140‚Üí### Updating from GitHub
   141‚Üí
   142‚Üí```bash
   143‚Üícd /nix-modules
   144‚Üísudo git pull origin main
   145‚Üísudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
   146‚Üí```
   147‚Üí
   148‚Üí### Manual Commit and Push
   149‚Üí
   150‚ÜíIf auto-commit is disabled or fails:
   151‚Üí```bash
   152‚Üícd /nix-modules
   153‚Üísudo git add -A
   154‚Üísudo git commit -m "Your commit message"
   155‚Üísudo git push origin main
   156‚Üí```
   157‚Üí
   158‚Üí## üêõ Troubleshooting
   159‚Üí
   160‚Üí### Hardware Configuration Issues
   161‚Üí
   162‚ÜíIf system won't boot after pulling from GitHub:
   163‚Üí1. Boot from previous generation (select in GRUB)
   164‚Üí2. Copy your hardware config:
   165‚Üí   ```bash
   166‚Üí   sudo cp /etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix /nix-modules/
   167‚Üí   ```
   168‚Üí3. Rebuild with `--impure` flag
   169‚Üí
   170‚Üí### GitHub Authentication
   171‚Üí
   172‚ÜíIf auto-push fails:
   173‚Üí```bash
   174‚Üígh auth login
   175‚Üí# Follow the prompts to authenticate
   176‚Üí```
   177‚Üí
   178‚Üí### Dirty Git Tree Warnings
   179‚Üí
   180‚ÜíThis is normal when you have uncommitted changes. The auto-commit module will handle this, or commit manually.
   181‚Üí
   182‚Üí### Permission Errors
   183‚Üí
   184‚ÜíMost operations require sudo as `/nix-modules` is system-wide:
   185‚Üí```bash
   186‚Üísudo git add -A
   187‚Üísudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
   188‚Üí```
   189‚Üí
   190‚Üí## üö¶ Best Practices
   191‚Üí
   192‚Üí1. **Always use `--impure` flag** when rebuilding
   193‚Üí2. **Test changes locally** before pushing to GitHub
   194‚Üí3. **Keep secrets out of configuration** - they'll be world-readable in Nix store
   195‚Üí4. **Regular commits** - Let auto-commit handle routine changes
   196‚Üí5. **Document custom modules** - Add comments for future reference
   197‚Üí6. **Version control discipline** - Review changes before rebuilding
   198‚Üí
   199‚Üí## üìö Additional Resources
   200‚Üí
   201‚Üí- [NixOS Manual](https://nixos.org/manual/nixos/stable/)
   202‚Üí- [Home Manager Documentation](https://nix-community.github.io/home-manager/)
   203‚Üí- [Hyprland Wiki](https://wiki.hyprland.org/)
   204‚Üí- [Nix Flakes Guide](https://nixos.wiki/wiki/Flakes)
   205‚Üí- [Hydenix Documentation](https://github.com/hydenix/hydenix)
   206‚Üí
   207‚Üí## ü§ù Contributing
   208‚Üí
   209‚Üí1. Fork the repository
   210‚Üí2. Create a feature branch
   211‚Üí3. Make your changes
   212‚Üí4. Test thoroughly with `nixos-rebuild build`
   213‚Üí5. Submit a pull request
   214‚Üí
   215‚Üí## üìÑ License
   216‚Üí
   217‚ÜíThis configuration is provided as-is for personal use and learning purposes.
   218‚Üí
   219‚Üí## ‚ö†Ô∏è Security Notes
   220‚Üí
   221‚Üí- Change default passwords immediately after installation
   222‚Üí- Don't commit secrets or sensitive data
   223‚Üí- Review all configuration changes before applying
   224‚Üí- Keep your system updated regularly
   225‚Üí
   226‚Üí## üí° Tips
   227‚Üí
   228‚Üí- Use `nixos-rebuild build` to test without switching
   229‚Üí- Check generation differences with `nixos-rebuild --rollback`
   230‚Üí- View system logs with `journalctl -xe`
   231‚Üí- List generations with `sudo nix-env --list-generations -p /nix/var/nix/profiles/system`
   232‚Üí
   233‚Üí---
   234‚Üí
   235‚Üí*Last updated: September 2025*
   236‚Üí*Powered by NixOS, Hydenix, and Hyprland*
   237‚Üí

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it looks malicious. If it does, you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer high-level questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

file.content:
# NixOS Hydenix Configuration

A modern, modular NixOS configuration using Hydenix, Hyprland, and flakes with automatic hardware detection and GitHub synchronization.

## üöÄ Features

- **Hydenix Desktop Environment** - Pre-configured Hyprland-based desktop with modern aesthetics
- **Automatic Hardware Detection** - Smart hardware configuration management that survives repository syncs
- **Auto-commit to GitHub** - Automatically commits and pushes configuration changes on rebuild
- **Flake-based Configuration** - Reproducible, version-pinned system configuration
- **Home Manager Integration** - Declarative user environment management
- **Modular Structure** - Clean separation of system and user configurations

## üìã Prerequisites

- NixOS 24.11 or later
- Git installed and configured
- GitHub account (for auto-sync features)
- Basic understanding of NixOS and flakes

## üõ†Ô∏è Installation

### 1. Clone the Repository

```bash
sudo git clone https://github.com/0x64616e61/nix-modules.git /nix-modules
cd /nix-modules
```

### 2. Hardware Configuration

The system automatically detects and uses your local hardware configuration. No manual copying required!

‚ö†Ô∏è **Important**: Always rebuild with the `--impure` flag to ensure hardware detection works:

```bash
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
```

### 3. Initial Setup

1. **Update User Configuration**
   - Edit `configuration.nix`
   - Change username from "a" to your desired username (lines 75 and 87)
   - Update initial password (line 89)
   - Set your hostname (line 103)
   - Configure timezone and locale (lines 104-105)

2. **Configure GitHub Authentication** (for auto-sync)
   ```bash
   gh auth login
   ```

3. **Build and Switch**
   ```bash
   sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
   ```

## üìÅ Project Structure

```
/nix-modules/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ flake.nix                 # Flake configuration entrypoint
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ flake.lock               # Version lock file
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ configuration.nix        # Main system configuration
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ hardware-config.nix      # Hardware detection wrapper
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ hardware-configuration.nix  # Placeholder (auto-replaced)
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ modules/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ system/             # System-level modules
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ auto-commit.nix # GitHub auto-sync module
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ hm/                 # Home Manager modules
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ docs/                   # Documentation
```

## üîß Configuration

### System Configuration

Main configuration file: `configuration.nix`

Key settings to customize:
- **Username**: Update in both `home-manager.users` and `users.users`
- **Hostname**: Set in `hydenix.hostname`
- **Timezone**: Set in `hydenix.timezone` (e.g., "America/New_York")
- **Locale**: Set in `hydenix.locale` (e.g., "en_US.UTF-8")
- **Hardware modules**: Uncomment relevant lines for GPU, CPU, laptop features

### Home Manager Configuration

User-specific configurations in `modules/hm/`

Manages:
- Desktop environment settings
- Application configurations
- User packages
- Dotfiles

## üéØ Key Features Explained

### Automatic Hardware Detection

The configuration includes a smart hardware detection system that:
- Uses `/etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix` when available
- Falls back to a placeholder for repository storage
- Survives git pulls without breaking your system
- Requires `--impure` flag for nixos-rebuild

### Auto-commit to GitHub

On every rebuild, the system:
1. Checks for uncommitted changes
2. Automatically commits with timestamp
3. Pushes to GitHub using `gh` CLI
4. Handles authentication gracefully

To disable auto-commit, remove this line from `configuration.nix`:
```nix
./modules/system/auto-commit.nix
```

### Hydenix Integration

Hydenix provides:
- Pre-configured Hyprland window manager
- Modern UI/UX with animations
- Integrated application launcher
- Workspace management
- Screen recording/screenshot tools

## üîÑ Daily Usage

### Rebuilding the System

Always use the impure flag for hardware detection:
```bash
cd /nix-modules
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
```

### Updating from GitHub

```bash
cd /nix-modules
sudo git pull origin main
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
```

### Manual Commit and Push

If auto-commit is disabled or fails:
```bash
cd /nix-modules
sudo git add -A
sudo git commit -m "Your commit message"
sudo git push origin main
```

## üêõ Troubleshooting

### Hardware Configuration Issues

If system won't boot after pulling from GitHub:
1. Boot from previous generation (select in GRUB)
2. Copy your hardware config:
   ```bash
   sudo cp /etc/nixos/hardware-configuration.nix /nix-modules/
   ```
3. Rebuild with `--impure` flag

### GitHub Authentication

If auto-push fails:
```bash
gh auth login
# Follow the prompts to authenticate
```

### Dirty Git Tree Warnings

This is normal when you have uncommitted changes. The auto-commit module will handle this, or commit manually.

### Permission Errors

Most operations require sudo as `/nix-modules` is system-wide:
```bash
sudo git add -A
sudo nixos-rebuild switch --flake .#hydenix --impure
```

## üö¶ Best Practices

1. **Always use `--impure` flag** when rebuilding
2. **Test changes locally** before pushing to GitHub
3. **Keep secrets out of configuration** - they'll be world-readable in Nix store
4. **Regular commits** - Let auto-commit handle routine changes
5. **Document custom modules** - Add comments for future reference
6. **Version control discipline** - Review changes before rebuilding

## üìö Additional Resources

- [NixOS Manual](https://nixos.org/manual/nixos/stable/)
- [Home Manager Documentation](https://nix-community.github.io/home-manager/)
- [Hyprland Wiki](https://wiki.hyprland.org/)
- [Nix Flakes Guide](https://nixos.wiki/wiki/Flakes)
- [Hydenix Documentation](https://github.com/hydenix/hydenix)

## ü§ù Contributing

1. Fork the repository
2. Create a feature branch
3. Make your changes
4. Test thoroughly with `nixos-rebuild build`
5. Submit a pull request

## üìÑ License

This configuration is provided as-is for personal use and learning purposes.

## ‚ö†Ô∏è Security Notes

- Change default passwords immediately after installation
- Don't commit secrets or sensitive data
- Review all configuration changes before applying
- Keep your system updated regularly

## üí° Tips

- Use `nixos-rebuild build` to test without switching
- Check generation differences with `nixos-rebuild --rollback`
- View system logs with `journalctl -xe`
- List generations with `sudo nix-env --list-generations -p /nix/var/nix/profiles/system`

---

*Last updated: September 2025*
*Powered by NixOS, Hydenix, and Hyprland*
